p: A concentration of actors on the supply or demand side can lead to harmful market power positions and create vulnerabilities. Where there is only a limited number of exporters, this can create a food security risk for importers, if trade is interrupted. Conversely, if exporters depend only on a small number of importing countries, shifts in demand can quickly affect their income. This can be particularly detrimental to developing countries where the agricultural sector is often a major source of livelihoods and income.
